intro: Cryptantha nesiotica, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
